title: All Hail The Power Of Jesus' Name
author: Edward Perronet, John Rippon, & Oliver Holden
lyrics:
[V]

;1-2
.    D/F#              A                           D/A  A     D
1All hail the pow'r of Jesus'   name! Let angels   pros_trate fall;
2Ye  chosen   seed of  Israel's race, Ye  ransomed from the   fall,
.A     D         D/F#      A      D                A/C# Bm   A/E E A
1Bring forth the royal     dia____dem,   And crown Him  Lord of__  all.
2Hail  Him Who   saves you by His grace, And crown Him  Lord of__  all
.      D         D/F#  A                 D/F#  G   D/F# A    
1Bring forth the royal     diadem, And       crown Him Lord__ of all
2Hail  Him Who   saves you by His grace, And crown Him Lord__ of all
;3-4 (Modulated)
.    E/G#             B                        E/B  B     
3Let every kindred,   every  tribe On  this terres__trial bal
4O   that with yonder sacred throng We at His  feet may   fal
.B     E        E/G# B   E                   B/D# C#m  B/F# F# 
3To    Him all  majesty ascribe,   And crown Him  Lord of___   all
4We'll join the ever_lasting song, And crown Him  Lord of___   all
.      E        E/G# B                 E/G#  A   E/G# B    
3To    Him all  majesty ascribe, And   crown Him Lord__ of all
4We'll join the ever_lasting song, And crown Him Lord__ of all.

title: Amazing Grace
author: John Newton
lyrics:
[V1]. D      D7        G         D          Bm      E           A  A
 Amazing grace how sweet the sound that saved a wretch like me
.  D        D7       G       D          Bm        A     G   
 I once was lost but now I'm found, was blind but now I see
[V2].     D          D7        G        D         Bm       E       A      A
 Twas grace that taught my heart to fear, and grace my fears relieved
.    D        D7       G       D        Bm     A       G      
 How precious did that grace appear the hour I first believed
[V3].        D    D7       G          D        Bm     E     A    A
 Through many dangers, toils, and snares I have already come
.     D          D7         G         D       Bm         A       G    
 'Tis grace that brought me safe thus far and grace will lead me home
[V4].     D          D7        G        D            Bm      E      A   A
 When we've been there ten thousand years bright shining as the sun
.      D       D7      G          D           Bm        A       G   
 We've no less days to sing God's praise than when we'd first begun!

title: A Mighty Fortress is Our God
author: Martin Luther
lyrics:
[V].Bb              F          Eb          Bb            Gm        Bb       Eb F B
1A mighty        fortress   is our      God, a        Bulwark   never    fa_i_ling
2Did we in       our own    strength confide, our     striving  would be lo___sing
3And though this world with devils      filled should threaten  to un____do   us
4That Word a_____bove all   earthly     pow'r, no     thanks to them a___bid__eth

.Bb           F         Eb        Bb           Gm       Bb        Eb F    B
1Our Helper   He a______mid the   flood of     mortal   ills pre__va_i____ling
2Were not the right Man on our    side, the    Man of   God's own choo____sing
3We will not  fear for  God hath  willed His   truth to triumph   through us
4The Spirit   and the   gifts are ours through Him who  with us   si______deth

.    Gm        Csus C     F          Bb      Eb      G
1For still our an___cient Foe doth   seek to work us woe
2Dost ask who  that may   be: Christ Jesus   it is   He
3The prince of dark_ness  grim, we   tremble not for him
4Let goods and kin__dred  go, this   mortal  life al_so

.     Gm        Csus  C   F           Gm         Cm      
1His  craft and pow'r are great, and  armed with cruel   hate,
2Lord Sabba_____oth   His name, from  age to     age the same,
3His  rage we   can   en__dure for    lo, his    doom is sure,
4The  body      they  may kill; God's truth a____bideth  still,
.    Gm       Bb         Eb F B
1On  earth is not his    e____qual
2And He must  win the    bat__tle
3One little   word shall fell him
4His kingdom  is for_____e____ver!

title: Great Is Thy Faithfulness
author: Thomas O. Chisholm
lyrics:
[V1]
.A            E             D        A
Great is Thy faithfulness, O God my Father,
.D           A         B7           E
There is no shadow of turning with Thee;
.E7            A           A7            D
Thou changest not, Thy compassions they fail not;
.Bm7          A             D    E    A
As Thou hast been, Thou forever will be.
[C]
.E            A             F#           Bm
Great is Thy faithfulness! Great is Thy faithfulness!
.E          A           B7        E
Morning by morning new mercies I see;
.E7         A           A7            D
All I have needed, Thy hands hath provided--
.B7           A             D      E  A
Great is Thy faithfulness, Lord unto me!
[V2]
.A          E          D              A
Summer and winter and springtime and harvest,
.D             A              B7       E
Sun, moon and stars in their courses above
.E7            A         A7       D
Join with all nature in manifold witness
.Bm7         A             D     E   A
To Thy great faithfulness, mercy and love.
[V3]
.A          E         D            A
Pardon for sin and a peace that endureth,
.D            A           B7           E
Thy own dear presence to cheer and to guide;
.E7             A              A7         D
Strength for today and bright hope for tomorrow,
.Bm7           A             D         E A
Blessings all mine with ten thousands beside.
